result.execSummary:
The defendant Dvonta P Ames was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge and pay all Court costs & victim/ witness surcharges; to be collected by the DOC from up to 25% of prison funds with balance to be paid by 07-01-17.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant advised that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Restitution is set at $0.  
Mental Health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.  
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification program.   
No drivers license suspension.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  
Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with random urine screens & breathalyzers

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dvonta P Ames

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (30 pages) commencing 30 received and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Dvonta P Ames in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 124 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/1/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No drivers license suspension
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. Matter will be addressed on the next court date. sab

Defendant Dvonta P Ames in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached an agreement. As to the Amended Information:

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Bail remains the same.

Received and Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement. 

Case adjourned to branch 15 for Sentencing. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM025415  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-19-2015
Final Pretrial held. Case remains on the calendar for Jury Trial on 6/3/2015.
Filed: Defendant's Witness List, Motion in Limine and Requested Jury Instructions; State's Requested Jury Instructions, State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine. sab

Defendant Dvonta P Ames in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Dvonta P Ames in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
State filed an amended information adding Count 2: Possession of Tetrahydrocannabinols (THC), pursuant to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e), an unclassified Misdemeanor. Defense waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty.

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Dvonta P Ames not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court is in trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND MADE ON 3-23-15.

Defendant Dvonta P Ames in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  Matter calendared for a status conference.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dvonta P Ames in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dvonta P Ames in custody.  Ron Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Michael Gasser.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.

Case recalled.  Attorney Daryl A Kastenson present and waived the appearance of the Defendant.  Ron Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Speedy trial demand entered.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CO-ACTOR:  JESSICA PERET.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dvonta P Ames in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Dvonta P Ames in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Defendant Dvonta P Ames not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance scheduled for this date 4-10-15. Defendant is in custody.  Both files sent to case prep.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/10/15 @ 1:30 pm
